Overview of University of Pretoria (UP)

The University of Pretoria (UP) is a public research university located in Pretoria, South Africa. It was founded in 1908 and is one of the largest universities in the country, with over 50,000 students and 4,000 academic staff members. UP offers a wide range of undergraduate and postgraduate programs across seven faculties, including Agriculture and Natural Sciences, Economic and Management Sciences, Education, Engineering, Built Environment and IT, Health Sciences, Humanities, and Law. The university is known for its research excellence, particularly in the areas of veterinary science, law, and engineering. UP has a strong focus on innovation and entrepreneurship, with a number of centers and programs dedicated to fostering innovation and supporting startups. The university also has a vibrant student life, with a variety of clubs, societies, and sports teams available for students to participate in.

About the University of Pretoria (UP) Postgraduate Application 2024

This is to inform all and sundry that the management of the University of Pretoria (UP) is inviting applications from interested and suitably qualified students (Indigents and International) for admission into Postgraduate programmes for the 2024 academic year.

Before you apply, see they know the actual programs (Course) available for the 2024Postgraduateadmission.

Visit UP Portal | University of Pretoria

To access the UP Portal (or UP Student Portal), you will need your UP student number and password. Here are the steps to access the UP Portal:

  1. Go to the University of Pretoria website (www.up.ac.za).
  2. Click on the “UP Portal” button at the top right-hand corner of the homepage.
  3. Enter your student number (or employee number) and password in the login fields.
  4. Click on the “Login” button to access your UP Portal.

UP Postgraduate Courses

The University of Pretoria offers a wide range of postgraduate courses across various faculties. Here are some examples of the postgraduate courses offered by UP:

Faculty of Natural and Agricultural Sciences:

MSc and PhD programs in fields such as Biochemistry, Biotechnology, Environmental Sciences, Physics, and Zoology.

Faculty of Economic and Management Sciences:

MCom, MPhil, and PhD programs in fields such as Economics, Accounting, Finance, Marketing, and Human Resource Management.

Faculty of Education:

MEd, MPhil, and PhD programs in fields such as Educational Psychology, Inclusive Education, Curriculum Studies, and Science Education.

Faculty of Engineering, Built Environment and IT:

MSc and PhD programs in fields such as Civil Engineering, Chemical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, and Architecture.

Faculty of Health Sciences:

MMed, MSc, and PhD programs in fields such as Medicine, Nursing, Public Health, and Sports Medicine.

Faculty of Humanities:

MA, MPhil, and PhD programs in fields such as Psychology, Political Science, Philosophy, African Languages, and Linguistics.

Faculty of Law:

LLM, MPhil, and PhD programs in fields such as Commercial Law, Human Rights Law, International Law, and Tax Law.

University of Pretoria Application Requirements

The admission requirements for the University of Pretoria (UP) vary depending on the program and level of study. However, here are some general undergraduate and postgraduate application requirements:

Undergraduate:

  • National Senior Certificate (NSC) or equivalent qualification
  • Minimum of 4 NSC subjects with a rating of 5 or above
  • Achievement of a minimum admission point score (APS) for the program applied for
  • English language proficiency test results (for non-native English speakers)
  • Some programs may require additional entrance tests, interviews or portfolio submissions

Postgraduate:

  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent qualification
  • Minimum average mark or weighted average mark (WAM) in undergraduate degree
  • CV or resume
  • Academic transcripts
  • Personal statement or statement of purpose
  • Research proposal (for research-based programs)
  • Two or more reference letters
  • English language proficiency test results (for non-native English speakers)

These requirements are general guidelines and may vary by program, so it’s important to check the specific requirements for the program you are interested in.

How to Access UP Application Portal login

To log in to your University of Pretoria (UP) application portal, you can follow these steps:

  1. Go to the UP website at www.up.ac.za
  2. Click on the “Study@UP” tab in the main menu.
  3. From the dropdown menu, select “Apply”
  4. On the application page, click on the “Login” button in the top right corner
  5. Enter your username and password that you used when you created your application profile
  6. Click on the “Login” button to access your application portal.

If you have forgotten your username or password, you can click on the “Forgot your username or password?” link below the login button and follow the prompts to retrieve your login details. If you continue to have difficulty accessing your application portal, you can contact the UP admissions office for assistance.

Step-by-Step Guide on How to Apply to the University of Pretoria

Here’s a step-by-step guide on how to apply to the University of Pretoria:

Choose your Program:

The University of Pretoria offers a wide range of undergraduate and postgraduate programs. Visit the university’s website to find a program that suits your interests and career goals.

Check the Admission Requirements:

Once you have selected a program, make sure you meet the minimum admission requirements. You can find the admission requirements on the university’s website.

Create an Online Application Account:

To apply to the University of Pretoria, you need to create an online application account. Go to the university’s website and click on “Apply” to create an account.

Complete the Online Application Form:

Once you have created an account, log in to the application portal and complete the online application form. Make sure you provide accurate information and complete all the required fields.

Upload Supporting Documents:

You will need to upload certified copies of your academic transcripts, ID or passport, and proof of payment for the application fee. Make sure you have all the required documents before starting the application.

Pay the Application Fee:

The application fee for the University of Pretoria varies depending on the program you are applying for. Make sure you pay the application fee before the deadline, as your application will not be considered without payment.

Submit your Application:

Once you have completed the online application form and uploaded all the required documents, you can submit your application.

Wait for a Response:

The university will review your application and notify you of their decision via email. This may take several weeks or months, depending on the program you applied for.

Accept your Offer:

If you are offered a place in the program, you will need to accept the offer by the specified deadline and pay the registration fee to secure your place.

Remember to keep track of all application deadlines and requirements, and to contact the university’s admissions office if you have any questions or concerns.

Documents Required for UP Online Application 2024

  • A valid NBT Academic Literacy Test Plus report with an overall score of Upper Intermediate or above.
  • A TOEFL iBT Score Report with an overall score of 88 or above, with at least 19 in Listening, 19 in Writing, 20 in Reading, and 22 in Speaking.
  • A valid IELTS Academic Test Report Form with an overall score of band 6.5 or above, with at least 6.0 in each component.
  • A valid PTE Academic Score Report with an overall score of 67 or above, with at least 59 in each communicative skills component.

University of Pretoria – UP Application Fees

The application fees for the University of Pretoria vary depending on the program you are applying for and your country of residence. Here are the current application fees for the 2024 academic year:

Undergraduate:

  • South African citizens/permanent residents: R300
  • SADC countries: R500
  • Non-SADC African countries and the rest of the world: R700

Postgraduate:

  • South African citizens/permanent residents: R300
  • SADC countries: R500
  • Non-SADC African countries: R800
  • Rest of the world: R1,500

How to Access UP Prospectus for Postgraduate

You can access the University of Pretoria postgraduate prospectus on the university’s website. Here’s how:
  1. Go to the University of Pretoria website at www.up.ac.za
  2. Click on the “Study@UP” tab in the main menu.
  3. From the dropdown menu, select “Postgraduate”
  4. Scroll down to the bottom of the page and click on the “Download the 2024 Postgraduate Prospectus” link (or the current year’s prospectus link if available)
  5. The prospectus will download as a PDF file, which you can save and/or print for future reference.

Alternatively, you can request a printed copy of the postgraduate prospectus from the admissions office by contacting them directly.

How to Access UP Application Status

To access your University of Pretoria (UP) application status, you can follow these steps:
  1. Go to the UP website at www.up.ac.za
  2. Click on the “Study@UP” tab in the main menu.
  3. From the dropdown menu, select “Apply”
  4. On the application page, scroll down to the “Track your application” section
  5. Enter your student number and the PIN you received when you submitted your application
  6. Click on the “Login” button to access your application status.

  • Fax: +27 (0) 12 362 5125
  • Email: csc@up.ac.za (general inquiries), ssc@up.ac.za (student inquiries), and more email addresses available on their website
  • Physical address: Lynnwood Road, Hatfield, Pretoria, 0083, South Africa
  • Postal address: University of Pretoria, Private Bag X20, Hatfield, Pretoria, 0028, South Africa

You can also visit the University of Pretoria website at www.up.ac.za for additional contact information, including contact details for specific faculties, departments, and services.
